sub.page.body.para: When we multiply a vector \mathbf{x} by a number (a scalar) t, we keep the direction of \mathbf{x} and multiply its length by t. If t is positive, this has the effect illustrated below.
If we multiply a vector \mathbf{x} by a negative number t, we reverse the direction of \mathbf{x}, as is illustrated in the picture below.
